verse.name: c1
verse.lines:
Arise! and possess your inheritance
This is the year of jubilee
Arise! and brake the yoke of bondage
For Christ has come to set the captives free

verse.name: v1
verse.lines:
I was entangled with heavy chains of captivity
I was bruised and mattered by sin
once condemned, and sentenced to a life of bondage
Oh God - there was no peace within

verse.name: v2
verse.lines:
But then a sound was heard
It was like the abundance of rain
It said "Rejoice, you have received the atonement.
Accept the pardoning work which was provided for you
because - you're not of the bound woman;
You're of the free

verse.name: v3
verse.lines:
Aren't you tired of living underprivileged
Saints don't you, listen, don't you hear that sound
Setting freedom to the captives
restoration to the blind
Setting free those who are bruiced

verse.name: v4
verse.lines:
Saints, empty your vessels and let him fill them with gold
You are free, you are free, you are free

verse.name: v5
verse.lines:
So when the creditor comes,
to take away your land
Show him your account
settled a long ago by Calvary's Lamb
I am free, I am free, I am free

verse.name: v6
verse.lines:
Now I can tell the world that I am free
I have heard the trumpet sound Jubilee
It sounded freedom from all burdens and sin
The Comforter has given me peace within
and "Whom The Son has set free is free indeed"
